intro: Anasser borbonica, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Anasser borbonica is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
